thread.title: Gucci Fall 2017 Runway Recap: Glitter, Pyramids, and Interstellar Prints
thread.title_full: Gucci Fall 2017 Runway Recap: Glitter, Pyramids, and Interstellar Prints

title: Gucci Fall 2017 Runway Recap: Glitter, Pyramids, and Interstellar Prints
text: Go Inside Gucci’s Fall 2017 Garden of Symbolic Earthly Delights February 22, 2017 5:19 PM by Steff Yotka Photo: Yannis Vlamos / Indigital.tv Gucci’s combined men’s and women’s Fall 2017 show was a full-on fashion spectacle. From the moment guests stepped into the plaza outside the venue, they were transported to a Gucci world courtesy of graffiti by Coco Capitán. Inside, there were celebs aplenty and a truly out-of-this-world set. In the show notes, the brand dubbed the collection The Alchemist’s Garden, using the requisite philosophical terms and a symbol of the ouroboros to explain the themes of the lineup. If that seems confusing, we’re breaking down Alessandro Michele’s latest here. Florence Welch and Hari Nef Photo: Alessandro Garolfalo / Indigital.tv The Majestic Set and Many Celebs Gucci’s show space was illuminated with royal purple lights. After such guests as Tom Hiddleston, Soko, Florence Welch, A$AP Rocky, and Hari Nef arrived, a curtain was pulled back to reveal a central pyramid with a rooster weather vane atop it, surrounded by a glass-enclosed runway. Consider the set design bar raised. Photo: Yannis Vlamos / Indigital.tv The Sheer Magnitude of Sparkle By and away this was Michele’s glitteriest Gucci collection yet. There were sparkling glasses, tights, hoods, and jewelry, and outfits made of shimmering floral brocades. This season, you can really be your own disco ball. Photo: Yannis Vlamos / Indigital.tv The Coco Capitán Collab Photographer Capitán collaborated with Gucci on shirts and accessories that featured her signature word prints scrawled across pieces. One tank was emblazoned with the phrase Common sense is not that common. Photo: Yannis Vlamos / Indigital.tv The Anatomical and Intergalactic Prints Gucci’s garden of delights included prints that ranged from small insects to illustrations of outer space. In between were vibrant florals and plenty of logos, proving that in Michele’s vision, everything is Gucci. Photo: Yannis Vlamos / Indigital.tv The Septum Piercings and Shining Hoods Jewelry and headwear are centerpieces of Michele’s collections. The designer whipped up some surprising numbers, including giant silver septum piercings and shroud-like hoods in glittering fabrics. There were also several large parasols trimmed in fringe, for those looking for shade but not keen on hats.
